page.title: 11Victorian Day
page.content: Werrington Infants School were having a Victorian Day,all the pupils and staff were dressed in Victorian style clothes .The boys wore knee-length trousers, boots,braces and caps.The girls wore longish dresses and aprons,and the teachers wore anklelength skirts and blouses. The children were taught as Victorian children would be.The teachers were a lot stricter with them.They had to sit rows instead of a group and the boys couldn't sit with the girls,also the children couldn't talk. Generally the classes have a class reading book but instead they had to read charts that were on the wall.The P.E. lessons were called Drill.These were different as well.Usually they played games but they had to do stretching exercises.The boys and girls liked dressing up like Victorians.
